identificationModule.briefTitle: Visual Feedback Therapy for Treating Individuals With Hemiparesis Following Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: Visual Feedback Therapy for Treating Individuals With Hemiparesis Following Stroke

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of the study is to determine whether an existing treatment for problems that participants have with making movements after a stroke can be performed at home.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: This study will compare two forms of home-based treatment for post-stroke problems making movements with the arms and hands. After initial pre-treatment assessments, participants will complete 4 weeks of treatment, with assessments after each week of treatment and 3 months after the completion of treatment.

armGroups.label: Mirror therapy
armGroups.description: 4 weeks of home-based mirror therapy. Participants practiced making movements with mirrored visual feedback of the low-functioning arm.

armGroups.label: Divider therapy
armGroups.description: 4 weeks of home-based divider therapy (control therapy to mirror therapy; mirror replaced by a divider). Participants practiced making movements with no visual feedback of the low-functioning arm.

interventions.name: Mirror therapy
interventions.description: A home-based therapy involving mirrored visual feedback

interventions.name: Divider therapy
interventions.description: A home-based therapy involving removed visual feedback.

primaryOutcomes.description: This test measures impairment-level ability to move the arm and hand. Scores range from 0 to 66, with higher scores indicating greater ability to move the arm and hand.
The test measures the ability to complete simulated everyday tasks with the arm. Scores range from 0 to 54, with higher scores indicating better performance.
This test measures the integrity of sensory perception of the arm. The score is the proportion of items answered correctly, and ranges from 0 to 1 with higher scores indicating better performance.

This test measures the ability to detect lateralized attention problems in a simulated navigation test. Evidence for lateralized attentional problems was defined as a 20% difference in item detection between the left and right side.

secondaryOutcomes.description: This test measures the self-reported ability to complete everyday tasks with the arm. Total scores for all items are reported. The scale ranged from 0 to 300, with higher scores indicating higher self-reported ability.
The test measures the ability to completed simulated everyday tasks with the arm. The scale ranged from 0 to 75, with higher scores indicating better performance.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* 6 months or more post-stroke
* upper extremity Fugl-Meyer score between 10 and 50
* no longer participating in upper-extremity physical or occupational therapy
* sufficient comprehension ability to understand instructions

Exclusion Criteria:

* previous head trauma, psychiatric illness or chronic exposure to medications that might be expected to have lasting consequences for the central nervous system (e.g., haloperidol, dopaminergics)
* dementia

groups.title: Mirror Therapy: High Functioning
groups.description:
4 weeks of home-based mirror therapy. Participants practiced making movements with mirrored visual feedback of the low-functioning arm.

High functioning was defined as pre-treatment upper extremity Fugl-Meyer score of 30-50.

groups.title: Mirror Therapy: Low Functioning
groups.description:
4 weeks of home-based mirror therapy. Participants practiced making movements with mirrored visual feedback of the low-functioning arm.

Low functioning was defined as pre-treatment upper extremity Fugl-Meyer score of 10-29.

groups.title: Divider Therapy: High Functioning
groups.description:
4 weeks of home-based divider therapy (control therapy to mirror therapy; mirror replaced by a divider). Participants practiced making movements with no visual feedback of the low-functioning arm.

High functioning was defined as pre-treatment upper extremity Fugl-Meyer score of 30-50.

groups.title: Divider Therapy: Low Functioning
groups.description:
4 weeks of home-based divider therapy (control therapy to mirror therapy; mirror replaced by a divider). Participants practiced making movements with no visual feedback of the low-functioning arm.

Low functioning was defined as pre-treatment upper extremity Fugl-Meyer score of 10-29.

groups.title: Total
groups.description: Total of all reporting groups

categories.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measures.title: Upper Extremity Fugl-Meyer
measures.description: This test measures impairment-level ability to move the arm and hand. Scores range from 0 to 66, with higher scores indicating greater ability to move the arm and hand.

measures.title: Action Research Arm Test
measures.description: The test measures the ability to complete simulated everyday tasks with the arm. Scores range from 0 to 54, with higher scores indicating better performance.

measures.title: Rivermead Assessment of Somatosensory Performance
measures.description: This test measures the integrity of sensory perception of the arm. The score is the proportion of items answered correctly, and ranges from 0 to 1 with higher scores indicating better performance.

measures.title: Stroke Impact Scale
measures.description: This test measures the self-reported ability to complete everyday tasks with the arm. Total scores for all items are reported. The scale ranged from 0 to 300, with higher scores indicating higher self-reported ability.

measures.title: Wolf Motor Function Test
measures.description: The test measures the ability to completed simulated everyday tasks with the arm. The scale ranged from 0 to 75, with higher scores indicating better performance.

measures.title: Virtual-reality Assessment of Navigation
measures.description: This test measures the ability to detect lateralized attention problems in a simulated navigation test. Evidence for lateralized attentional problems was defined as a 20% difference in item detection between the left and right side.

outcomeMeasures.title: Upper Extremity Fugl-Meyer
outcomeMeasures.description: This test measures impairment-level ability to move the arm and hand. Scores range from 0 to 66, with higher scores indicating greater ability to move the arm and hand.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: All participants who started the treatment were included. Data for any participants who failed to complete the treatment were imputed.

groups.title: Mirror Therapy: High Functioning
groups.description:
4 weeks of home-based mirror therapy. Participants practiced making movements with mirrored visual feedback of the low-functioning arm.

High functioning was defined as pre-treatment upper extremity Fugl-Meyer score of 30-50.

analyses.nonInferiorityComment: Test for the superiority of Mirror therapy over Divider therapy.
analyses.pValueComment: ANCOVA analysis with post-treatment score as the dependent variable, therapy type (Mirror therapy or Divider Therapy) as the independent variable, and pre-treatment score as the covariate. P-value reported is for the main effect of therapy type.

outcomeMeasures.title: Virtual-reality Assessment of Navigation
outcomeMeasures.description: This test measures the ability to detect lateralized attention problems in a simulated navigation test. Evidence for lateralized attentional problems was defined as a 20% difference in item detection between the left and right side.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: No participants were administered the test in the post-treatment phase because no participant exhibited a baseline 20% difference in item detection between the left and right side.
